title: Just a moment...
notes: I'm here to help! Please go ahead and share the data related to the battery production projects in Europe, and I'll extract and summarize the key information for you.

title: Northvolt raises $1.2bn and Northvolt Dwa produces first ESS
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Gdańsk, Poland, where Northvolt Dwa has assembled its first energy storage system (ESS) products as part of its commissioning process. 

Capacity:
- The new 25,000 square meter plant in Gdańsk assembles cells into battery systems for customers in energy storage and industrial markets. The current operational capacity is not specified.

Investment amounts:
- The company has raised $1.2 billion in an extension of the $1.1 billion convertible note signed in July 2022. The investment comes from funds labeled dark green in accordance with Article 9 of the EU's Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation. The European Innovation Fund has also provided support for the project. In total, Northvolt has secured over $9 billion in equity and debt.

Project progress:
- Northvolt Dwa has assembled its first energy storage system (ESS) products in Gdańsk, Poland, and is in the final validation of production lines. Customer deliveries are expected to commence later in the year.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new 25,000 square meter plant in Gdańsk, Poland, to assemble cells into battery systems for energy storage and industrial markets.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers the stages of cell fabrication, where cathode and anode are combined with an electrolyte, and module assembly.

Additional notes:
- Battery cells are designed and developed at Northvolt Labs in Västerås, Sweden, and Northvolt Cuberg in San Leandro, California, US. Battery cell manufacturing is ramping up at Northvolt Ett gigafactory in Skellefteå, Sweden, and an adjacent giga-scale recycling plant, Revolt Ett, is due to start operations later this year. Additional projects are under development in Sweden, Germany, and Portugal.

title: NORTHVOLT ETT -LARGE SCALE BATTERY PLANT
notes:
Location
The project is located in Skellefteå, Sweden.

Capacity
The planned capacity of the lithium-ion battery cell manufacturing facility is 16 GWh, structured into two components, each with a manufacturing capacity of 8 GWh.

Investment amounts
The total cost of the project is approximately EUR 1522 million, with proposed EIB finance of approximately EUR 400 million.

Project progress
As of the latest available information, the project was under appraisal as of 15/06/2018.

Project type
The project involves the design, construction, commissioning, and operation of a new lithium-ion battery cell manufacturing facility.

Value chain stages
The facility will cover the manufacturing of lithium-ion electrodes, cells, and batteries, falling under the Environmental Impact Assessment Directive 2014/52/EU.

title: Northvolt's battery factory to be built in Skellefteå
notes:
Location:
- The battery production plant is planned to be located in Skellefteå, Sweden.

Capacity:
- The factory is expected to have a total capacity of 32 GWh of battery production per year when fully built in 2023.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- Northvolt aims to commence construction in the second half of 2018 and have the first quarter of the plant completed and in production by 2020.

Project type:
- This is a new build project, with the construction of the battery production plant starting from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the entire value chain stages, including cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: Northvolt To Step Up Battery Cell Output With $2.75 Billion Equity Round
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Skellefteå, Northern Sweden.

Capacity:
- The project's capacity is planned to increase from 40 to 60 GWh a year, enabling the production of enough batteries for 1 million electric vehicles annually.

Investment amounts:
- An additional $2.75bn equity fund raising has been agreed upon, bringing the total raised by the Swedish startup to over $6.5bn. The investment is led by four Swedish pension funds, OMERS Capital Markets, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, and Volkswagen Group, with institutional investors including AMF, Baillie Gifford, and EIT Inno Energy. Private shareholders include notable investors such as Spotify founder Daniel Ek, Christina Stenbeck, and Norrsken VC.

Project progress:
- The project, named Northvolt Ett, has been under construction since Summer 2018 and is expected to start production later this year. Production is anticipated to ramp up gradually over the next 3 - 5 years.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the gigafactory being constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will be capable of recycling lithium, cobalt, nickel, manganese, and other metals, covering the value chain stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: From start-up to scale-up: Europe’s first homegrown gigafactory
notes:
Location: Europe, specific country and area not mentioned.

Capacity: N/A

Investment amounts: The European Investment Bank provided a series of loans backed by the EU’s InnovFin innovation-support facility and the Investment Plan for Europe. The bank financed the company’s demo plant.

Project progress: The project began with the European Investment Bank providing loans for the company’s demo plant. Subsequently, customers started placing orders, and private sector banks and long-term investors became involved.

Project type: N/A

Value chain stages: N/A

title: Battery venture could transform sub-Arctic Sweden
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Skellefteå, Sweden.

Capacity:
- The factory is planned to produce 8 GWh of batteries annually by 2020, with a projected increase to 32 GWh by 2023.

Investment amounts:
- The European Investment Bank has committed €350 million in loans to Northvolt.
- Volkswagen has agreed to invest €900 million in Northvolt, securing a 20 percent stake and a seat on the board.

Project progress:
- The project is currently in the construction phase, with the factory being built in a massive clearing in the woods a couple of kilometers from the town center.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the factory being constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

This information provides a comprehensive overview of the battery production project in Skellefteå, Sweden.
